title: SHAP DeepExplainer not working with functional API
body:
Hi,
First -  many thanks for creating such a great library!

I have a model that I have created using the Keras functional API: 

```
early_stop = EarlyStopping(monitor = 'val_loss', 
                           mode = 'min', 
                           verbose = 1, 
                           patience = 20)
def mlp_model():
  model = tf.keras.Sequential([
    tf.keras.layers.Dense(60, kernel_initializer = 'glorot_uniform', activation='relu'),
    tf.keras.layers.Dense(32, activation='relu'),
    tf.keras.layers.Dense(8, activation='relu'),
    tf.keras.layers.Dense(1) # sigmoid for abs regression
  ])

  model.compile(optimizer='adam',
                loss = root_mean_squared_error,
                metrics=['mean_squared_error', 'mean_absolute_error'],
                dropout=0.20)
  return model
```

This is then called and trained successfully:

```
model = mlp_model()
model_history = model.fit(train_batch, 
                          validation_data = test_batch,
                          epochs = 100,
                          callbacks = [early_stop])
```

however when I try to create a SHAP DeepExplainer:

`explainer = shap.DeepExplainer(model, X_train)`

I get the following error:

AttributeError: Layer dense_296 has no inbound nodes.

Furthermore if I try creating by passing model_history I get:

AssertionError: <class 'tensorflow.python.keras.callbacks.History'> is not currently a supported model type!

I should note that I am using a DataSetAdapter to fit this model i.e. Dataset from tensor slices.

Thanks!
